subject: Music
title: Verdi and Italian Opera
description: A micro-lesson that makes Verdi and Italian Opera usable.

hook.text: Giuseppe Verdi made opera so popular that his name became a political rallying cry.

buildup.text: Aida, La Traviata, and Rigoletto are among the most performed operas in the world.

discovery.text: His chorus Va Pensiero became an unofficial national anthem during Italy's unification.

twist.text: VERDI was an acronym â€” fans used it to mean Vittorio Emanuele Re D'Italia.

climax.text: He turned opera from aristocratic entertainment into the people's art form.

punchline.text: His music united a country before politicians could.

quiz.question: What political significance did Verdi's name have?
options: It was used as an acronym supporting Italian unification
